snippet: At a school in Queens, Mayor Bill de Blasio spoke about “SWAT teams” for schools with poor leadership, newly aggressive language that comes as Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo pushes state involvement.
abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio defends his administration's attempts to help troubled city schools, comparing effort to war; statement strikes different tone compared to more upbeat language used by mayor in his early days in office and comes as Gov Andrew M Cuomo is pushing competing vision for dealing with city schools.
lead_paragraph: At a school in Queens, Mayor Bill de Blasio spoke about “SWAT teams” for schools with poor leadership, newly aggressive language that comes as Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo pushes state involvement.

headline.main: Mayor de Blasio Defends Efforts to Help Struggling Schools
headline.print_headline: Mayor Defends Efforts to Help Struggling Schools
